title: Kylian Mbappe tests positive for Covid-19 while playing with France
description: French football star Kylian Mbappe has tested positive for Covid-19 while on international duty, the French Football Federation (FFF) announced on Monday.

title: Saudi court sentences suspects in Jamal Khashoggi murder
description: Saudi Arabia has issued "final verdicts" against eight suspects in the murder of Washington Post journalist Jamal Khashoggi in October 2018 -- sentencing five of the defendants to 20 years in prison -- the state-run Saudi Press Agency (SPA) has reported, citing a public prosecutor spokesman.

title: Trump launches unprecedented attack on military leadership
description: President Donald Trump launched an unprecedented public attack against the leadership of the US military on Monday, accusing them of waging wars to boost the profits of defense manufacturing companies.

title: Russian opposition leader out of coma after poisoning, hospital says
description: Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny is out of a medically induced coma, the German hospital where he is being treated said in a statement on Monday.

title: Biden says he would get vaccine even if it cost him the election
description: Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden says he would get a Covid-19 vaccine if it became available and that President Donald Trump's misstatements about the coronavirus could undermine the public's confidence in a vaccine.

title: Another comeback win for Serena Williams at the US Open
description: Serena Williams pulled off another comeback win at the US Open on Monday, ensuring the weakened Grand Slam event didn't lose a legendary player for a second consecutive day.

title: A Houston family whose eviction was filmed receives thousands in donations
description: The law enforcement officers who evicted a young Houston father and his family days later set up a GoFundMe that has raised more than $180,000 to help him and other families facing eviction.

title: Father captures dramatic wildfire rescue during camping trip
description: The California Creek Fire suddenly engulfed the camp site where Jeremy Remington and his family were staying, leading to a helicopter rescue he caught on camera.

title: Belarusian opposition says three leading members were abducted
description: Belarus' political opposition has said three of its leading members have been abducted, and called for their immediate release.

title: 'Foul mood': CNN analyst calls out Trump's attitude at briefing
description: CNN's Brooke Baldwin, Gloria Borger, Abby Phillip and Jim Acosta fact check President Trump's Labor Day news conference.

title: Britain is staring down the barrel of a no-deal Brexit again, and people on both sides are spooked
Why the Australia-EU trade model isn't a 'good outcome' for Britain
description: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson is threatening to walk away from faltering trade talks with the European Union if a deal isn't reached next month, leaving Britain staring down the barrel of a damaging no-deal Brexit again.

title: McEnroe on Djokovic: 'He's going to be the bad guy the rest of his career'
description: Novak Djokovic hitting a line judge with a ball has become one of the enduring images of an already bizarre season of tennis.

title: Scale model of futuristic plane makes successful maiden flight
description: Researchers in the Netherlands ​say they have conducted a successful maiden flight of a scale model of the Flying-V, a plane that could one day carry passengers in its wings.

title: Tourist who took sand from Italian beach fined over $1,000
description: A French tourist has been ordered to pay a €1,000 ($1,200) fine after attempting to fly out of Sardinia with more than four pounds of local sand in his luggage.

title: US service member injured in Al-Shabaab attack
description: A US service member was injured in Somalia Monday when Al-Shabaab attacked US and Somali forces, according to the US military.

title: World's slowest musical composition, set to play out over 639 years, just changed a chord
description: A musical composition designed to take well over 600 years to play has gone through its first chord change in seven years.

title: Hear Jacob Blake's message from his hospital bed
description: Speaking from his hospital bed as recovers from the injuries he sustained after being shot seven times by a Kenosha, Wisconsin, police officer, Jacob Blake delivered a message to his supporters, warning them that everything can change in an instant. Blake is now paralyzed from the waist down.

title: Confessions of an RV rookie -- and former naysayer
description: I had no idea when I decided to take the family on an RV vacation this summer that I would have to learn a whole new vocabulary.

title: An Air Force One that flies at five times the speed of sound?
description: There could be a supersonic Air Force One prototype airplane as early as 2025, with the US Air Force getting busy awarding development contracts.

title: It's like nowhere else on Earth. Now it's in peril
description: Two veteran travel writers hope their crowdfunded book about the Yemeni island of Socotra will bring more attention to its unique landscape and wildlife and ensure it's safeguarded during a time of turmoil.

title: India alerts China after reports allege troops 'abducted' several civilians on disputed border
description: The Indian military has alerted China to allegations five men were "abducted" by the People's Liberation Army near the countries' hotly-disputed border in the Himalayas, an Indian official said Sunday.

title: A multibillion-dollar shopping obsession goes mainstream in China
description: Eight months ago, Meng Hu quit her job as a flight attendant in Guangzhou, China to pursue her dream of becoming an online star.

title: Vibrating suit allows deaf people to 'feel' music
description: Music is said to be a universal language. But for Chase Burton, a deaf filmmaker from Texas, music has always been a profoundly different experience.

title: Schiff accuses Barr of lying over election intelligence
description: House Intelligence Chairman Adam Schiff on Sunday accused Attorney General William Barr of lying about intelligence related to foreign interference in the upcoming presidential election.

title: Boris Johnson is battling to reach a Brexit deal. But hardliners already fear betrayal
description: When Boris Johnson first took over as British Prime Minister, many in his Conservative Party couldn't believe their luck. After years of watching Theresa May's government rub out red line after red line on Brexit, the man who led the triumphant march to freedom in 2016 was in charge.

title: India didn't prioritize mental health before Covid-19. Now it's paying the price
description: "My heartbeats are heavy. It becomes difficult to catch my breath. My hands shake and get sweaty," said Aritri Paul of the terrifying panic attacks that strike more frequently since India went into coronavirus lockdown in March.

title: California governor declares state of emergency as multiple counties battle wildfires
description: California Gov. Gavin Newsom declared a state of emergency in five counties late Sunday as multiple wildfires continue to burn across the state following a weekend that brought both record high heat and record acres scorched.

title: Trump faces new character tests as campaign enters final stretch
description: Maybe the biggest surprise about allegations President Donald Trump uttered rude dismissals of American war dead was how unsurprising it really was.

title: China launches and recovers reusable spacecraft: state media
description: China has launched and recovered a reusable spacecraft, an important step in the country's space program, state media reported Sunday.

title: India overtakes Brazil as country with second-highest number of Covid-19 cases
Nearly 300 arrested in Hong Kong protests over postponed local elections
description: Nearly 300 protesters were arrested in Hong Kong on Sunday, according to the city's police force, during one of the largest pro-democracy demonstrations since China imposed a national security law in June.

title: Nikki Haley's risky move on anti-Trump ad
description: Before Nikki Haley left the Trump administration as the US ambassador to the United Nations, she was not afraid to disagree with Donald Trump publicly. For example, after Trump infamously sided with Vladimir Putin in July 2018 over US intelligence agencies' conclusion that Russia's had interfered in the 2016 US elections, Haley stated, "We don't trust Russia. We don't trust Putin," adding, "They're never going to be our friend."

title: LA County records highest-ever temperature
description: Los Angeles County recorded its highest-ever temperature Sunday as the weekend heat fanned wildfires across California and put additional strain on the state's power network.

title: World No. 1 Novak Djokovic defaulted from US Open after striking line judge with ball
description: The US Open was supposed to be a slam dunk for Novak Djokovic but instead of moving closer to Roger Federer in the Grand Slam record books, the world No. 1 was defaulted Sunday when he struck a line judge with a ball.

title: Indian food: The best dishes in each region
description: When ordering "Indian" food in places such as the United States or the UK, garlic naan, biryani, butter chicken and dal are ubiquitous.
